supporting.text: Donald Trump's paternal grandparents, Friedrich Trump and Elizabeth Christ Trump, were German immigrants, making him of German descent.

attacks.text: Donald Trump's paternal grandparents, Friedrich Trump and Elizabeth Christ Trump, were German immigrants, making him of German descent.
Being of German descent does not make someone German; nationality is determined by citizenship, not ancestry.
Donald Trump was born in the United States, which automatically grants him American citizenship, not German.
German descent does not imply German nationality, as Germany does not automatically grant citizenship based on ancestry.
Germany's citizenship laws require at least one parent to be a German citizen at the time of birth, which was not the case for Trump.
The U.S. Constitution's 14th Amendment guarantees citizenship to anyone born in the U.S., overriding claims based on ancestry.

supporting.text: Donald Trump was born in the United States, making him an American citizen by birth, not German.

attacks.text: Donald Trump was born in the United States, making him an American citizen by birth, not German.
Birthplace alone does not determine nationality; dual citizenship or ancestry could still make Trump German.
Historical records show Trump's ancestors were German, which could imply cultural or legal ties to Germany.
Dual citizenship requires formal recognition by both countries, and there is no evidence Trump holds German citizenship.
Ancestry does not confer nationality; Trump has never claimed or legally asserted German citizenship.
Germany's citizenship laws do not automatically grant citizenship based on distant ancestry without formal application.

supporting.text: German citizenship is not automatically inherited beyond one generation born outside Germany, so Trump does not hold German citizenship.

attacks.text: German citizenship is not automatically inherited beyond one generation born outside Germany, so Trump does not hold German citizenship.
Trump's grandfather, Friedrich Trump, was a German citizen, and German law at the time allowed citizenship to pass to descendants regardless of birthplace.
Historical German citizenship laws were complex and often required active steps to retain citizenship, which Trump's ancestors may not have taken.
Even if Trump had a claim to German citizenship, he never applied for or asserted it, making his German identity legally irrelevant.
German law does not require active assertion of citizenship if it is inherited automatically under applicable laws.
Trump's public identification as American and lack of engagement with German institutions undermine any claim to German identity.
National identity is not solely determined by legal citizenship but also by cultural and personal affiliation, which Trump has never expressed toward Germany.

supporting.text: Trump has never identified as German nor held any official ties to Germany beyond ancestry.

attacks.text: Trump has never identified as German nor held any official ties to Germany beyond ancestry.
Ancestry alone can confer cultural or legal ties, such as citizenship by descent, which Trump could theoretically claim.
German citizenship by descent requires formal application and proof, which Trump has never pursued.
Public identification is not the sole determinant of nationality; legal and familial ties matter more.
Trump's grandfather was German, but his father was born in the U.S., making Trump a natural-born American citizen with no automatic German legal status.
Historical records show Trump's family actively distanced themselves from German identity post-WWI, undermining ancestral ties.

supporting.text: Cultural and national identity is more than ancestry; Trump's upbringing and public persona are distinctly American, not German.

attacks.text: Cultural and national identity is more than ancestry; Trump's upbringing and public persona are distinctly American, not German.
Ancestry plays a significant role in national identity, and Trump's German heritage is well-documented.
Many Americans with immigrant ancestry still identify strongly with their heritage, which can influence their national identity.
Trump's public statements and policies often reflect a distinctly American nationalist perspective, not a German one.
Nationalist perspectives are not exclusive to any one nationality and can be adopted by individuals of any heritage.
Cultural identity is fluid and can be influenced by multiple factors, including ancestry, regardless of upbringing.
While cultural identity is fluid, upbringing and environment are primary determinants, overshadowing ancestry in most cases.
